Description: Male face in relief: in opaque bright-blue glass now turned white on the surface and faces right. The eye and eyebrow, now empty, were originally inlaid. The features are idealized without any element of portraiture, but it is possible that Amenophis III is represented. The ear and upper edge of the face are lost.
Curator's comments: With the exception of work executed under Ramesses III, these glass relief faces seem to have been restricted in the New Kingdom to royal representations.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.37, pp.36-37)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
